fields.description:
h5.Summary:

* Confluence 5.4.3
* PostgreSQL 8.4.13

An entry in the {{user_mapping}} table has a null value for the {{lower_username}} field, which causes users to be shown as 'unknown user' when searching.

Your database may look like this:

{noformat}
             user_key             |         username         |      lower_username      
----------------------------------+--------------------------+--------------------------
 ff808081407d63f001407d643c890515 | rprice                   | rprice
 ff808081407d63f001407d643a70018f | rprice                   | 
 ff808081407d63f001407d6439df0079 | rcummins                 | rcummins
 ff808081407d63f001407d643a370125 | rcummins                 | 
{noformat}

h5.Resolution:
Remove the user mappings with null values from the database. See CONF-36018 for the set of SQL queries to achieve this.

h5.Avoiding this in the future:
Is it possible to add a constraint to {{lower_username}} to prevent null values?
fields.summary: Null value in user mapping leads to "Unknown Users"

fields.description:
When trying to create a jira issue using the jira issues macro in confluence, it seems to hang when trying to choose an Assignee. 
A couple things to note: 
- I've already tried re-creating the app links between confluence and jira (multiple times)
- I'm able to create jira tickets for other projects that don't show Assignee as a required field in the macro (even though it's required in Jira) - not sure why this is..

I'm seeing the below warning in atlassian-jira.log:

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33701].
  {panel}

If a user have a word file containing forms and use the Insert ‘Office Word’ Macro to view that file into a Confluence page he will be able to type in on the form fields.

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Uses Microsoft Word to create a .doc/docx.
# To add a form to this document click in file > Word Options.
# "Customize Ribbon"
# In the right panel check the "Developer" check box.
# Now that you added the developer tab click on it.
# "Click in Legacy Tools"
!img1.PNG|thumbnail!
# Add the text form.
!img2.PNG|thumbnail!
# Save the word doc.
# Create a page in Confluence and use the insert Office macro to insert the created doc.
# Once you save the page you will notice that you will be able to type in the form fields.
!img3.PNG|thumbnail!

h4. Note
* This miss behaviour *does* not cause any harms to Confluence or the attached doc file.
* I attached the "Simple Character Sheet.docx" as an example.
* You can also follow [this|http://office.microsoft.com/en-us/word-help/create-forms-that-users-complete-or-print-in-word-HA010030746.aspx] link for instructions on how to add the text forms.
* Tested with MS Office 2010/2013 document.
fields.summary: Either prevent excel form fields from being editable or allow the information to be saved back to the document

fields.description:
PDF space exports fail.  They used to work, though we had a problem some time ago where the size of the export was too large, which we fixed by expanding the memory limits for the java process.  (That problem, if I remember correctly, had an out-of-memory error that we're not getting this time.)

When I initiate one from the xmlrpc interface (using the same code which we have been using to initiate space exports for quite some time) I get a successful intermediate HTML export, and then the folowing error:

xmlrpclib.Fault: <Fault 0: "java.lang.Exception: com.atlassian.confluence.rpc.RemoteException: Exception thrown while rendering the page 'Windows_InChild Path Error_Statewide_Campus' to the PDF document /opt/ole/data/confluence/temp/pdfexport-20140520-200514-1053-215/ITSACADSCAN-200514-1053-216.pdf">

I tried exporting that page only and it works fine.  I tried adding a new page to the space that I thought would come before that one in the export (to see if it was failing at a certain-sized export) but it still failed at the same page.  I tried exporting the space from the web interface, and the HTML intermediate again worked, but the PDF export seemed to silently fail - the "Exporting" tab on my browser just changed itself to the dashboard.  It left behind, on the server, in a temp directory, an artifact file that does not open with a pdf reader.  (And which is too large to attach here.)  I tried exporting the space from the web interface, doing a Custom export, and excluding the page that it fails on; this just caused it to fail while rendering a different page, though leaving a message this time:

Failed during PDF export. Exception message - Exception thrown while rendering the page 'Windows_APPCRASH_Statewide_Campus' to the PDF document /opt/ole/data/confluence/temp/pdfexport-20140520-200514-1146-223/ITSACADSCAN-200514-1146-224.pdf

The only message in the tomcat log is:

May 20, 2014 11:51:08 AM org.apache.jk.common.ChannelSocket processConnection
WARNING: processCallbacks status 2
fields.summary: PDF Space Export fails from web or xmlrpc

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33699]. {panel} Suddenly today, the HEADERS and FOOTERS on my exported PDF documents are no longer working properly, without me doing any changes on the html. This is example of the HEADER html, which used to create two lines accross my page, and inbetween the two lines my logo on the left side and the filename on the right side. But today, suddenly this same code is only drawing the HEADER for 1/3 of the page, but not stretching across the page as before. Same issue applies to two different spaces, so I suspect some system changes have been made on the OnDeman installation.

my_filename_Vvv
fields.summary: Headers and Footers not working properly for PDF export

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33698].
  {panel}

every change that I make on the pages of confluence: delete, insert, update, my colleagues in my own space users are receiving an email. this behavior is becoming a problem. even though I have disabled the automatic notification of changes in the pages or spaces I do not know what other configuration panel to act to prevent this flood of email.

ttps://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Subscribing+to+Email+Notifications+of+Updates+to+Confluence+Content

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+the+Recommended+Updates+Email+Notification

I've read these two pages and also many other associates. the problem is that it seems to be the default for every user the function of watching the space. this can not be disabled even if you are administrator of the plan. it seems that an operation should be voluntary on the part of users.
fields.summary: how to stop email notifications

fields.description:
Hi Team,

After upgrade of Confluence 5.1.4 to Confluence 5.4.4, we are experiencing a weird behaviour of Keyboard shortcuts pop up. It is showing a key : com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.recently.viewed.keyboard.shortcut.open.recent.descgthenr instead of the value "Open Recently Viewed" to be displayed.

Steps to replicate:

1. Navigate to Help
2. Click on Keyboard Shortcuts
3. Pop up opens but having a key for Open Recently viewed instead of the value which is disturbing for the users. Please refer to the screenshot attached. 

This is quite urgent and needs to be fixed. Is this a known issue for this version? Can we have a resolution on hand? We did not get anything relevant over the internet.
fields.summary: Keyboard shortcuts pop up showing key instead of value
Sort content in space categories drop-down list in spaces macro
Moved blog post should prompt with new location

Root cause:
{code}
Caused by: com.atlassian.crowd.exception.DirectoryNotFoundException: Directory <24379393> does not exist
{code}

An examination of the cwd_directory table in the database shows that the directory no longer exists.

h3. Workaround
Flush the Embedded-Crowd caches in the Confluence in-memory cache via Confluence Admin > Cache Statistics. Clicking "Flush All" also works since that clears all the caches.

This workaround is also described in the following KB: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Unable+to+Access+User+Directories+Screen+After+Deletion+of+An+User+Directory

If this method does not work, you can also try restarting Confluence, which will ensure no in-memory cache remains.
fields.summary: User directory sometimes remains cached after removal from database

fields.description:
# Install Confluence and JIRA, and set up applinks between them
# Create a space, give it Anonymous Access
# Create an entity link between the Confluence Space and a JIRA project
# Disable _global_ anonymous access on Confluence
# Delete the applink

This will fail, leaving the entity link behind, and probably the applink.  This is because the space has anonymous access but Confluence does not have global anonymous access.

This happens because the entity links are discovered by querying for all viewable spaces (only considering space permissions) then checking if the spaces is viewable (which does consider global access).

See: https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/AC-1079

The fix is to change the query used when entity links are discovered to include the permission check.

See: https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/AC-1079?focusedCommentId=128546&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-128546
fields.summary: Failure when deleting entity links on spaces with anonymous access

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
# In JIRA, create a filter using the plus sign in the JQL (e.g. {{text ~ "A+B"}})
# Export > XML and copy the URL of this XML
# In Confluence, insert a JIRA macro. Paste the JIRA XML link as its source

h3. Expected result
Confluence issues a JIRA search for text "A+B"

h3. Actual result
Confluence issues a JIRA search for text "A B". Looks like the %2B in the URL is being decoded by Confluence to a whitespace instead of a + sign. This can be problematic if the user wants to search for the literal + character.

Interestingly this seems to be the opposite scenario of CONF-32319.
fields.summary: Confluence JIRA Macro turns plus signs into whitespace after decoding JIRA Issues Navigator XML link

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33680].
  {panel}

If you install Confluence on an Oracle schema with a dot on it, you'll face "Could not get unique fields for table" errors. 

It would be nice to have a warning if the user inserts something like CONFLUENCE5.5 telling him this is unsupported and recommending the use of underscores instead of dots. i.e.: CONFLUENCE5_5

fields.description:
Confluence console down returns error 500.
No changes were made. Unable to resolve. System restarted, DB is good. Cannot restore from daily ZIP backups with console down. 
Your website has no information on how to self-resolve. Need support!
fields.summary: Confluence server on Windows returns 500 errors.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33678].
  {panel}

Using those browsers in Windows, Linux, and OSX when a .mp4/.mp3 file is embedded with auto play unchecked, it still plays automatically. In other browsers it does not happen, waiting for the play click as expected.

Tested with:
- Safari Version 8.0.6 (10600.6.3)
- Chrome Version 42.0.2311.135 (64-bit)
- Firefox Version 38.0.1

Steps to reproduce:
1. Insert an .mp4 video in a Confluence page.
2. Let the "auto play" checkbox unchecked.
3. Open the page in any of those browsers.

Workaround (Chrome):

Use the [Disable HTML5 Autoplay|https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/disable-html5-autoplay/efdhoaajjjgckpbkoglidkeendpkolai?hl=en] to disable all HTML5 Autoplay in Chrome
fields.summary: Chrome/Firefox/Safari ignores auto play option on multimedia macro
Search macro attributes

fields.description:
When trying to upgrade plugins I get the following error

The system attempted to connect to http://wiki.zag.soe.hr/rest/plugins/1.0/pending/089fdfea-bb25-438c-b264-8baf10105da9 to retrieve the status of your operation, but failed. This can indicate a problem with the base URL configuration of your instance. Try refreshing the page to see if the operation completed, and see UPM documentation for more details about this error.

The Server Base URL is set to http://wiki.zag.soe.hr

The site sits behind Apache2 and is correctly accessed via http://wiki.zag.soe.hr. 

At the same time I have both newly installed Jira and Stash systems configured on the same box with the same Apache2 set up and these allowed updated to be installed without any issues.

All the dns info above is the real info as these systems are not open to the internet so don't need to hide the details.
fields.summary: UPM under Confluence reporting connection error on upgrade

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33675].
  {panel}

1. Upload an xls spreadsheet to a page as an attachment
2. Insert an 'Office Excel' macro on that page

Expected: I should be able to select the xls attachment in the 'File Name' dropdown
Actual: No file is shown
fields.summary: Office Excel Macro - xls attachment not selectable

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In email notifications when the content of a page is displayed, all Confluence internal links (attachments, pages,...) are wrong and only point to the address {{[http://server.base.url/#]}}.

For issues regarding anchor links in the notifications mail, watch the following bug report: CONFSERVER-58737

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a confluence that has a mail server
# Create a page that contains a link of the following
## Link to another page
## Link to attachments
# Send the content of that page in a mail notificaitons

h3. Expected Results
Clicking the link will take you to the correct link

h3. Actual Results
The link does not work and only take you to a link with the following address
{code}
http://server.base.url/#
{code}

h3. Notes
Links to external pages (i.e.: [http://www.google.com|http://www.google.com/]) work as expected.

h3. Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Internal Confluence links in notification email not correct

fields.description:
The file {{server.xml}} contains the following comment:
{noformat}        <!--
            To run Confluence via HTTPS:
             * Uncomment the Connector below
             * Execute:
                 %JAVA_HOME%\bin\keytool -genkey -alias tomcat -keyalg RSA (Windows)
                 $JAVA_HOME/bin/keytool -genkey -alias tomcat -keyalg RSA  (Unix)
               with a password value of "changeit" for both the certificate and the keystore itself.
             * Restart and visit https://localhost:8443/

             For more info, see http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Adding+SSL+for+Secure+Logins+and+Page+Security
        -->{noformat}

The page [http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Adding+SSL+for+Secure+Logins+and+Page+Security] no longer exists in our documentation.
fields.summary: File server.xml contains link to non existing page

fields.description:
h4.Steps to Reproduce:
# Create a Page in IE 11 (Version: 11.0.9600.16428).
# Edit Page.
# Save.
# Edit Page Again.
# Internet Explorer has Stopped Working.
# Click on *Close the Program*.
# Edit Page Again.
# Save.
# IE Stopped Working Again.
!1.JPG|width=512!

h4.Expected Results:
IE Should save the page every time.
h4.Actual Results:
IE Stopped working.

h4.Findings:
If repeat mentioned procedures several times, page will redirect to this URL  {{res://ieframe.dll/acr_error.htm#,http://localhost:8555/conf/display/SPACEKEY/TESTPAGE}} and following error appears:
!2.JPG|width=512!

h4. Workaround

Update IE11 to a version equal to or greater than: 11.0.96000.16438.
fields.summary: Can't Edit Page in IE 11

fields.description:
# Create a user that is not a space admin, and does not have restrictions permissions on the space
# Create a File List. Prompted for restrict access to:
# Add couple of users
# Page is created with restrictions. User can click the lock to view the people who are restricted, but cannot edit or add more people. 

Should this user even be able to restrict the File List? If so, why can they not then change the restrictions?
fields.summary: Strange behavior with restrictions on File List Blueprint

fields.description: When exporting a page that contains a Tasklist into a Word document, the following warnings will show in logs (2 for every task): {code} 2014-05-15 13:34:53,125 WARN [http-5543-6] [atlassian.confluence.servlet.ExportWordPageServer] extractImagesFromPage Skipping datasource creation for non-relative url: http://localhost:5543null -- url: /exportword | userName: admin | referer: http://localhost:5543/display/TEST/testpage 2014-05-15 13:34:53,125 WARN [http-5543-6] [atlassian.confluence.servlet.ExportWordPageServer] extractImagesFromPage Skipping datasource creation for non-relative url: http://localhost:5543null -- url: /exportword | userName: admin | referer: http://localhost:5543/display/TEST/testpage {code} The export process seems to be referencing null images, perhaps the checkbox and expand/collapse button. These invalid images can also be found when examining the storage format of the resulting Word document in a text editor: {code} ... TESTING123 ... {code} Because this does not impede the Export-to-Word functionality in Confluence, and the file is generated as expected, I've raised this bug as Trivial. Ideally we'd suppress or address these WARN messages in the future to clean up the logs.
fields.summary: Warnings thrown in logs when exporting page containing Tasklist to Word document

fields.description:
After [uploading a font file to Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Creating+PDF+in+Another+Language], the underlined text generated by PDF Export always have a thick underline.

h5. Steps to replicate
# [Upload a font file to Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Creating+PDF+in+Another+Language]
# Create a new page containing underlined texts (combine Bold, Italic, Underline formatting)
# Export PDF out of the newly created page
# In the PDF, the underline always appears as thick underline

h5. Workaround
No workaround at the moment
fields.summary: Thick Underline When Exporting Page to PDF with Custom / Installed Font

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33662].
  {panel}

Greetings, we have recent begun cleaning up our Wiki by leveraging both manual arching and the plug-in from Midori.

We have about 15,000 pages of which 7,000 or more should be archived.

The challenge is that the Popular Posts activity stream is including content that was recently moved to an Archive space based on the popularity of the content. 

In some cases, we have content from 3+ years ago showing up as popular and with our overall activity of Confluence, it's preventing us from doing any more archiving.

I'm happy to provide further details if possible.

-Jim
fields.summary: Exclude archive content from popular content stream

fields.description:
One would expect that instructional text that is only visible in edit mode does not influence view mode. Unfortunately this is not the case, instructional text is visible as an empty line in view mode.
The look of pages created by a template depend on the fact if the user deleted the instructional text or not. This effect is obvious in tables where in edit mode there is normal text on the first line and instructional text on the second line. 
I do agree this bug is not critical, but pages look very clumsy with different row heights, etc...

Hope this helps in improving your product.
Kind regards,

Siegfried
fields.summary: Instructional text occupies space in view mode

fields.description:
In Confluence 5.3.4, when trying to export content via "Custom Pdf Export" results in an IllegalArgumentException. The "Normal Export" works as expected without any error.

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Via "Space tools" browse to "Content Tools" and click on tab "Export";
# Choose PDF as export format and click "Next";
# Click on "Custom Export".

The following error message appears (-> screenshot 1)

{quote}
*Error Loading Pages*
An error was encountered loading page for the space demo2. Please contact your administrator for help.
Internal Server Error error: url=/spaces/flyingpdf/flyingpdftree.action params=key=demo2
{quote}

*Footnotes*

fields.summary: Exporting space content via Custom Pdf Export results in IllegalArgumentException

fields.description:
After inserting large images (1600px) via drag&drop into the editor they are displayed in original size (1600px) - as expected. But after changing the size from 1600px to 1200px the image is automatically scaled down to 900px. 
Is it a bug or a feature? 
If it is a feature then the scaling-down of images (to 900px) should be done when I (drag&)drop the image into the editor - and it should also not be possible to resize the image (to 1600px) by clicking "original".
fields.summary: Image size can only be increased to 900px

fields.description:
When you navigate to Blog within the space you find a little search blog input field on the right side. (confluenceURL/pages/viewrecentblogposts.action?key=foo)

It is not working. No input and no submit.
fields.summary: Search Blog Functionality broken
Disable the feature follow in confluence 5.2

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33651].
  {panel}

In the JIRA report macro, the "Sprint" field is available for display, but this displays the ID and not the display name.

The ID is mostly unhelpful for anyone using this report.

Screenshot attached.

_This may be covered by CONF-31534 but I can't tell in the description if Sprint is being modified in addition to Epic._
fields.summary: Display the Sprint Name for items in the JIRA Report

fields.description:
*Steps To Reproduce:*
1. Insert the Space List Macro within a page and navigate to the user's personal space.

2. As an admin, change the user's username through the Admin console.

3. Access the Space List Macro as the user whose name has been changed and select the user's personal space. This should redirect you to 'Page Not Found'. 

*Expected Results:*

Expected to be redirected to the user's personal space.

*Actual Results:*

Redirected to 'Page Not Found'.
URL for the personal space contains old username instead of the new username, for example:

If the username was changed from user1 to newuser1

{CODE}<confluencedomain>/display/~user1  <--- Page Not Found{CODE}

instead of

{CODE}<confluencedomain>/display/~newuser1 <--- Correct Path{CODE}

*Workaround:*

Navigate to the user's personal space via profile pic (top right corner).
fields.summary: Space List Macro Redirects To Page Not Found After Username Change

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33648]. {panel} I have found a detail which would be important to put on the documentation about [Importing Pages from Disk|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Importing+Pages+from+Disk]: When importing a text file, Confluence ignores all the new lines and space characters, breaking the user's text layout. So, it turned out that adding the tag *
* at the beginning of the text file and closing it with *
* at the end of the file makes Confluence correctly import it, keeping the space/new line. Having said that, I would like to add a note about it to the official documentation. Example: To import text files keeping the file's layout: Add the tag {{
}} at the beginning of the file and close this tag with {{
}} at the end. In case you are using Unix like environment, this job can be done to all files inside a specific directory using the following command line: 1. Go to the directory where the files are in. 2. Run {code}for i in $(ls); do echo "
" >> m$i; cat $i >> m$i; echo "
" >> m$i; mv m$i $i; done {code} This is also an update request from a customer.
fields.summary: Update on latest documentation about Importing Pages from Disk

fields.description:
We are using confluence version 5.4.3 and crowd version 2.7.1.

When we rename a user in crowd, the changes reflects in Confluence after performing Confluence Admin> User Directories > Synchronise in Confluence.

We found that user has been renamed almost everywhere. But this is not renamed at notification tab.(Screenshot Old_Username_On_Notification_Tab.png).

For example, we have a user 'testuser2 testuser2' with user name 'testuser2'.
Now we have renamed this user from 'testuser2' to 'testuser4' and display name from 'testuser2 testuser2' to 'testuser4 testuser4'.
But this is not reflecting on Notification tab in the comment section as shown at Screenshot Old_Username_On_Notification_Tab.png.

Ideally the user name should also be changed here. Because whenever user click on username at 'testuser2 testuser2' displaying at Notification tab (Screenshot Old_Username_On_Notification_Tab.png) then it is showing that 'Page not found' page (Screenshot Page_Not_Found.png). We can see here in the screenshot 'Page_Not_Found.png' that old user name 'testuser2' is displaying on the url.

Is there any fix/workaround for this issue?
fields.summary: Old user name is displaying on notification tab, while the user name has been renamed
Make 'm' shortcut do a quote comment if you have text selected

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33642].
  {panel}

The number of columns the gallery macro uses must currently be set to a fixed number. However there are cases where I would prefer the images to be flowed (in CSS-speak), that is:

For e.g. 9 images and 3 cols:
*Currently:*
Wide window: 3 rows x 3 cols
Medium window: 3 rows x 3 cols
Small window: 3 rows x 3 cols + scrollbar
…
*Requested:*
Wide window: 2 rows x 5 cols
medium window: 3 rows x 3 cols
small window: 5 rows x 2 cols
…

This could be done by setting the number of columns to "*" or "0".
fields.summary: Gallery Macro: Flowed layout / variable column count

fields.description:
Middle mouse button paste fails on Linux systems when pasting content into a Confluence wiki page while using the Chrome web browser.

MMB paste works with all my other browser-based applications (like JIRA and Shotgun) and even Gmail, but it does not work in Confluence. This is a Confluence *bug* (since MMB paste is standard Linux behavior), not a Chrome bug.
fields.summary: Middle mouse button paste on Linux fails
Copy and Paste the Content from Other Editors

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 13 May 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5|titleBGColor=#3C78B5|titleColor=#FFFFFF|bgColor=#E7F4FA}

This issue has been duplicated by the issue at [CONFSERVER-25880 - Copy and Paste Row that contains Macro Breaks Row Paste| https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-25880]. Please watch that issue for further updates and more detailed workarounds.
{panel}

*Description:*
There’s a discrepancy between the behaviour of the shortcuts for cut/copy paste (table editing) on Confluence and the O.S. cut/copy paste. When using the Confluence shortcut in a table cell which is using a macro (e.g.: expand macro), pasting the content in another section of the table, the macro’s content is pasted into another cell, instead of remaining inside the macro; whereas when using the O.S. shortcut it does not happen and the content remains inside the cell.

*Steps to reproduce:*
 1. Create a table in a Confluence page (e.g.: 4x4). 
2. Select a table cell which is not in the heading row, and insert the expand macro with some content.
 3. Cut this row and past it into a different section of the table using the Confluence shortcut. 
!TableCutCopyPaste.png!

!before.png!

*Actual Results:* The contents of the expand macro are pasted into another table cell.
!after.png!

* Expected Results:* The expand macro contents should remain inside of the expand macro.

This behaviour *does not happen if you use the O.S. shortcut (cmd/ctrl + x/c and cmd/ctrl + v)*, only when using the Confluence shortcuts.
The same behaviour happens with other macros. e.g.: Section Macro, Column Macro, Info Macro, etc.
fields.summary: Cut/Copy-Paste table shortcut issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33637].
  {panel}

I have a user that is experiencing an issue with Confluence. Below is the text of the issue provided me:



There are actually 2 bugs, and they are manifest on this page:

https://confluence.iparadigms.com/display/VIS/Current+Train+Assignments?moved=true

Bug #1)
The priority order that we actually want is from this page: https://confluence.iparadigms.com/display/VIS/Cross-Prioritization+Dashboard

So in order to only have to do the ordering once, I put this this expert/expert-include of the "Approved Backlog". It was working for a few weeks. But about 3 weeks ago, I noticed that some of the features are missing and some of the features are listed twice.
Example: AMT2.0/Revamp - which is the last on this list (https://confluence.iparadigms.com/display/VIS/Cross-Prioritization+Dashboard)…

(see attachment Conf1)


Does not appear on the expert-include page (https://confluence.iparadigms.com/display/VIS/Current+Train+Assignments?moved=true) at all:
   
(see attachment Conf2)

You'll also note that "Exclude match/phrase" is listed twice. (Top and bottom of the 2nd picture)

(see attachment Conf3)

Bug #2)
In the 2nd column, there is an adhoc board with title "New Board". When you move pages up and down in the list, the ordering used to be preserved, even after you refreshed. But now, if you move the pages, and refresh, the ordering (or priority that we use this board for) is not preserved and goes back to a different ordering. 

This priority preservation and planning boards are vital to our planning process, so we really need these fixed!

h5. Overview

The links are still shown correctly in *Preview* mode but after saving it, the links are all broken

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33609].
  {panel}

h5.Synopsis

When browsing to a space that you don't have permissions for, Confluence give inconsistent warning messages - see https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-33608.

If a user does not have access to a space, it would be great if the System Administrator could allow people to request access to the Space - either on a system wide basis, or a per Space basis.

The flow of access request would work much like the current process for requesting access to a restricted page.
fields.summary: For spaces users don't have permission for, allow users to request access

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33608].
  {panel}

h5.Synopsis:
If you browse to a specific page in a restricted space that you don't have access to, you'll receive a 404 error stating that the page cannot be found, or perhaps that you don't have access to it.

As per [Matt Ryall's comment on CONF-9239|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-9239?focusedCommentId=149238&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-149238], this is to ensure that we do not "leak information about the existence or non-existence of spaces which users don't have permission to see."

A few comments later in the same ticket, [Charles Miller comments that|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-9239?focusedCommentId=150837&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-150837] you can bypass the ambiguous 404 message to get a hard "Not Permitted" or "Doesn't Exist" error when browsing to the space key directly.

If you have a restricted space with the key "RS", and the page title is "Restricted Space Home", the following is true:

# Browsing to {{/display/RS/Restricted+Space+Home}} produces the ambigous 404 error
# Browsing to {{/display/RS/}} displays a "Not Permitted" action.
# Browsing to {{/display/FOO/}} (that doesn't exist) displays a "Page Not Found" error.
fields.summary: Confluence is inconsistent in error messages for restricted spaces

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33607].

Currently, Confluence Mobile does not render PageTree Macro.
I use a lot of Page Tree Macro without any contents in a page.
In this case, I totally lose my navigation ability. 

Please, support this macro.It is mandatory for navigating.

Thank you.

h4.Workaround:
The [Children Display Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Children+Display+Macro] works on mobile view and offers a similar experience.
fields.summary: Add supporting PageTree Macro for Confluence Mobile

fields.description:
Sorry the summary was difficult to type.

This will be specifically for the "Requirements" macro, but may affect other sorting issues.

When, in the macro, I say "Sort on column = Title", the macro shows in the preview, for example:

1.0 - Requirement 1
2.0 - Requirement 2
10.0 - Requirement 10

The 'number' format is being considered in the sort.  

Issue:

When the table is initially displayed in "View", the sort of the table will be

1.0 - Requirement 1
10.0 - Requirement 10
2.0 - Requirement 2

honoring a 'text' sort.

Now...interestingly enough, if you click on the "Title" header, it will resort the list,   1.0, 2.0, 10.0 in the order expected.

So, the issue is "The sorting is inconsistent"

May have something to do with CONF-26808
fields.summary: In the Requirements macro, table inital display sort differs from 'click' sort

fields.description:
The following errors is shown when Confluence tries to send email to external email addresses:
{code}
com.atlassian.mail.MailException: javax.mail.SendFailedException: Invalid Addresses; nested exception is: com.sun.mail.smtp.SMTPAddressFailedException: 550 5.7.1
... Relaying denied. IP name lookup failed [10.5.131.50]
{code}

The Confluence server has two IPs, one for management with ssh and one for everything else.
- 10.5.131.50: ssh management IP
- 10.5.131.21: service address
- In server.xml, Confluence is configured to use IP 10.5.131.21 as mentioned in this [KB article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Forcing+Confluence+to+Bind+a+Specific+Interface]
- server's name is _test1_ (alias _testmachine_, which is the service address thru nginx proxy)
- in DNS _test1_ and _testmachine_ have been configured as 10.5.131.21
fields.summary: Confluence Server has two IPs and mail relaying gets rejected because wrong IP is used

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33597].
  {panel}

As a user, I would like to be redirected to Personal Spaces (if available) when clicking on usernames in the People Directory.

*Current behavior*: you are redirected to the user's Profile (/display/~admin for example).

*Expected behavior*: to be directed to /spaces/viewspace.action?key=~admin.  This especially makes sense when clicking on *People with Personal Spaces* in the People Directory.


I've tested this in a few older versions and it appeared to be already behaving the expected way in versions 4.x, and changed in 5.0.1.  So this might be considered a regression instead of an improvement request.
